unnormalised: **EV Charging Scene Heating Up Faster Than a Mumbai Local During Rush Hour!**
normalised: **Electric Vehicle Charging Scene Heating Up Faster Than a Mumbai Local During Rush Hour!**

unnormalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! Remember that iconic scene in "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" where Raj boards the train at the last minute? Well, getting an EV charge might soon feel less like that frantic chase and more like a leisurely chai break.
normalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! Remember that iconic scene in "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" where Raj boards the train at the last minute? Well, getting an Electric Vehicle charge might soon feel less like that frantic chase and more like a leisurely chai break.

unnormalised: The EV charging infrastructure is revving up, with more charging stations popping up than chai stalls on Linking Road. IIT Delhi is reportedly working on some super-efficient charging tech, promising to drastically reduce charging times.
normalised: The Electric Vehicle charging infrastructure is revving up, with more charging stations popping up than chai stalls on Linking Road. Indian Institute of Technology Delhi is reportedly working on some super-efficient charging tech, promising to drastically reduce charging times.

unnormalised: We're seeing fast chargers cropping up along the Delhi-Jaipur highway, making those long road trips less anxiety-inducing. Companies are even exploring battery swapping tech – just pop in a fresh battery and you're good to go!
normalised: We're seeing fast chargers cropping up along the Delhi-Jaipur highway, making those long road trips less anxiety-inducing. Companies are even exploring battery swapping tech – just pop in a fresh battery and you're good to go!

unnormalised: Plus, whispers are circulating about potential government subsidies to encourage more charging point installations, especially in Tier 2 & 3 cities. It's rumored that charging your car at home could soon cost less than Rs. 10 per unit!
normalised: Plus, whispers are circulating about potential government subsidies to encourage more charging point installations, especially in Tier two and three cities. It's rumored that charging your car at home could soon cost less than rupee ten per unit!

unnormalised: So, ditch the range anxiety and get ready to embrace the electric future, folks! The change is happening faster than you can say "Bijli Bill"!
normalised: So, ditch the range anxiety and get ready to embrace the electric future, folks! The change is happening faster than you can say "Bijli Bill"!

unnormalised: Expect more news as this space further evolves! Stay tuned!
normalised: Expect more news as this space further evolves! Stay tuned!
